moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nd4: 3. ...  Nd4!? last time when i have encountered this variation i have been trapped.. and i lost the game..

as have comment by:

 heinzkat  (2202) on 19-Feb-08:
I think you somehow missed 7. ... Qxe4  with AT LEAST a perpetual check for Black already. Maybe even more... via 8. Kd1 Qxc2  9. Ke1 Qe4  it's a draw; via 9. Ke1 Qxc1  10. Qd1 Nc2  Black should be winning.
moves.8. Qh4 Nxc2+ 9. Ke2 Nxa1 10. Nc3: 10. Nc3!? is a good move to prepare for a check in d5..and probably have a mate in the later game.
here he wants to save his horse..but not quite..because he will be trapped.
